intro: Geiseleria chamaedrifolia, commonly known as the creeping greenbrier, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, thorny stems that grow close to the ground, forming a mat-like structure. Its small, opposite leaves are usually oval to elliptic in shape, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Geiseleria chamaedrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
